documents.title: PRD: Cancellation Funnel Unification
documents.content:
ÔªøPRD

Product Requirements Document (PRD): Cancellation Funnel Unification

1. Overview & Purpose

This PRD outlines the requirements for unifying the cancellation funnels across all HelloFresh Group brands. The primary goal is to leverage the existing HelloFresh cancellation funnel, including its deflection strategies and cancellation survey, and apply it to the remaining RTE, meal kit and new venture brands. This initiative aims to standardize the cancellation experience, improve customer retention for Factor and other brands, and streamline operational and technical maintenance. Depending on the engineering complexity, we consider two possible rollout scenarios:

1. [preferred] A/B test for all brands excl. Hellofresh, with control = BAU and variation = complete unified funnel. Alternatively, the test can target Factor US customers only.

2. Roll out without an A/B test, with the pre-post performance analysis

Decision about the prioritised rollout scenario will be taken by Karolina Zak/Edward Day once the effort estimation is known.

2. Goals & Non-Goals

Goals:

1. Use Hellofresh Cancellation Funnel UX in the remaining brands: Replicate the proven HelloFresh cancellation flow UX, including deflections and feedback collection, onto the other brands (all meal-kit, all RTE, The PetsTable, GoodChop, Factor Form, ?Factor Programs?[a][b][c][d]).

   1. !! This requirement does not mean using Hellofresh funnel code across brands. The initial engineering proposal is to create a new cancellation funnel module and move the Hellofresh flow pieces into this new cross-brand funnel. Once this is setup we can migrate the funnels to use this new app

2. Easy handling of all funnel variations: all the existing cancellation funnel variations (BAU flow, one-step funnel, one-click funnel, French adjusted funnel) need to be handled in a scalable way and allow reusing existing flows in other brands and markets

3. Standardize Cancellation Surveys: Implement the HelloFresh cancellation survey framework for other brands to gather consistent customer feedback on reasons for cancellation.

4. Unify Deflection Strategies: Make all existing deflection mechanisms available for use (not necessarily enabled) in all other brands cancellation funnels, including:

   1. Special deflections offered in a dedicated page sections:

      1. Benefits of keeping the subscription active (available discounts & credits, loyalty program status) ‚Üí do not show if a customer doesn‚Äôt have a discount nor credit nor loyalty program status

      2. Switch to other brand (offered post cancellation) ‚Üí Removed from the initiative scope. Remember to keep it live for Hellofresh brand.

   2. Regular deflections offered in small modular boxes:

      1. Offer new discount - Emmanuelle Hazeauxto clarify the ownership of the voucher creation for all brands and markets ‚Üí changed from special deflection to the regular module - needs small design change

      2. Change plan frequency ‚Üí links to the second step of the deflection, where customers can select alternative plan frequency

      3. Change plan size ‚Üí there‚Äôs no price information, it has one of the lowest deflection rates. Therefore in the new funnel we want to send customers directly to the subscription settings page (!different links for different brands: HF /account-settings/subscription-settings, Factor /settings/plan/plan-selection)

      4. Help me skip ‚Üí change to ‚ÄúSkip instead of cancel‚Äù, redirect to the homepage/single week page with a simple onboarding about using ‚ÄúEdit delivery‚Äù feature (only if skipping CTA is hidden



l not support having an active RTE subscription without an active meal kit subscription so for launch we added an "orchestration layer" that cancels the RTE subscription when the meal kit subscription is cancelled

[p]@nikita.gorshkov@hellofresh.com @kza@hellofresh.com It's not clear to me what consequences this project has for analytics - are cancellation metrics and GA events already aligned cross-brand or would we have to shake up our events and reporting as part of this push?





How about dashboarding?

[q]+ revisit the cancellation dashboard

[r]I think this needs to be investigated a bit further, but general cancellation metrics should be unified overal (at least looking at Tableau as the SoT here). Of course, cancellation reason-level reporting is different.

[s]what about Voice of customer team, should we we consider them as dependencies as they are the primary users of the cancellation survey results, maybe we need to check how it would impact them

1 total reaction

Juan Sebastian Hernandez reacted with üôè at 2025-09-05 15:25 PM

[t]Who would be your primary contact for this team?

[u]@juan.hernandez@hellofresh.com

[v]@kza@hellofresh.com my read from this is that we don't make any changes to the BAU survey experience for any brand/market other than maybe the UI - am I right in this?

[w]Hey team, hope you're doing well and thanks for flagging @ehaz@hellofresh.co. I assume that from our end there is no big change as we only send the comments to Chattermill. Not sure if this would affect more the existing categories in Cancellation data sets, so I'll add @winnie.huang@hellofresh.com to the conversation

[x]Q on my side - how do we ensure market level compliance?

[y]what do you mean by compliance? Compliance to regulations?

[z]Yes cancellation tends to be regulated at a local level.





On top of legal compliance, I wonder if there are non-legal decisions we've taken at a local level that we also should look to preserve

[aa]Q2: Governance - the ability to change survey & deflections by brand/market will only be available to the owning _technical_ team right? We have no requirements to enable other stakeholders to modify this?

[ab]If so, it means owning tech team owns final decision on local setups (with local input) due to balancing capacity

[ac]i don't know why i imagined green chef being also sustainable so i'm curious why is not there today

### EMAIL: Now in Cursor: Web Layout Editor and Debug Mode
ID: 19b262bfdbd09ac0
From: Cursor Team <hi@mail.cursor.com>
----------------------------------------

Hello,



We're releasing two new features that make writing and fixing code faster: a browser-based layout editor and Debug Mode.



Browser Layout Editor



Design and code simultaneously with the new layout and style editor ( https://cursor.com/blog/browser-visual-editor ) built into the Cursor browser. Drag and drop components, update colors using your design system, build layouts and grids, and add shadows or gradients as needed.



Once the design is perfect, click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù to delegate your visual changes to the agent.



Debug Mode



Debug Mode ( https://cursor.com/blog/debug-mode ) is a new way to fix tricky bugs. Instead of writing new code, prompt the agent with a description of the issue. Then, the agent explores your codebase, adds instrumentation, and uses runtime logs to find and fix the root cause.



Try Debug Mode and everything else new in Cursor 2.2 ( https://cursor.com/changelog/2-2 ).



We‚Äôre excited to see how you use it!



Best,

Cursor Team



Unsubscribe ( https://track.customer.io/unsubscribe/dgT_pwsDANT_zQXT_80FAZskr7InpW4rB63G3_n0jw== )

ID: 19b23d9151931690
From: "'Rachel LeMier' via EveryPlate Recipe Survey Results" <ep-recipe-survey-results@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi team,





EveryPlate 2025 Week 48 resulted in an overall menu score of 3.46 (-0.04 target

score of 3.50, -0.08 vs planned menu score of 3.54).





CPI Commentary: W48 was Thanksgiving week, leading to limited amount of

feedback. Low performers this week included slot 1 (Crispy Chicken with

Honey Dijon Drizzle) and a new meal (Meatloaf Sandwiches) but commentary

was very sparse making it hard to determine why these meals underperformed.





Please see our full report

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_TfgFk61X6aohfhev6eHDOOYWyA-MRC39xe1qGQL1X4/edit?gid=389153776#gid=389153776>

for

in-depth WoW views.

favorite.  My husband actually eats veggies with the sauce mixed in"

### EMAIL: HelloFresh US 2025-W48 Recipe Report
ID: 19b2301668766752
From: "'Rachel LeMier' via Recipe Survey Results" <recipe-survey-results@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi team,





HelloFresh 2025 Week 48 resulted in an overall menu score of 3.46 (-0.04 target

score of 3.50, -0.05 vs planned menu score of 3.51).





CPI Commentary: Scores this week were still impacted by the broccoli

shortage. In addition, Slot 2 Sweet Thai Chili Burgers scored a 3.36 with

several complaints about bland flavor and the quality of the beef.





Please see our full report

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mVR6C-x_UMmuY9lgn3VC0N-SdEnfhMcwM2eX9sMpse0/edit?gid=389153776#gid=389153776>

for

in-depth WoW views.





Weekly Call-Outs:



   - SKU Launches:

      - Chosen Foods Mayo - 0.42 Ounce (oz) - Brand Partnership - 1 Unit,

      Slot 2

      - Mandarin Oranges, In-Juice - 4 Ounce (oz), Slot 13

   - *Quality*

      - R14 - steak was tough

      - R87 - eggplant was rotten and mushy





Recipe of the Week:



Smoky BBQ Chicken Quesadillas, RS 3.66 and demand 8.2. L3 "So good, super

fast and easy to make. The bbq and the crema flavours together are so

yummy. Definitely a favorite."





Referenced Links

   Recipe Report

   <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mVR6C-x_UMmuY9lgn3VC0N-SdEnfhMcwM2eX9sMpse0/edit?gid=965641887#gid=965641887>

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúConnect on CA B2B Shopify Integration‚Äù Dec 15, 2025
ID: 19b22e9ea0ea3178
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúConnect on CA B2B Shopify Integration‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 15, 2025, 5:47 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Elysa Viti initiated a discussion with Nikita Gorshkov about the Canadian  

B2B site, which requires Shopify as middleware because no current systems,  

except Katana, support the necessary B2B functionality out of the box; the  

site aims to automate small business employee orders (Factor only), which  

are currently manual and error-prone. Nikita Gorshkov emphasized that the  

success of B2B depends on a strong sales presence, and confirmed that zero  

people are currently allocated to B2B development, with expectations that a  

dedicated B2B team may be pushed for around June, leading Elysa Viti to  

estimate a Q3 launch for the Shopify integration. The strategy for the  

first half of the year involves manually testing streams like sports teams  

and gyms, and Elysa Viti suggested a separate team should handle B2B.





Suggested next steps





Elysa Viti will talk to Kieran and have him send over his business case so  

that she can tweak it for Canada.



Elysa Viti will forward all meeting notes over to Kevin and Cole for them  

to read up on and will keep Nikita Gorshkov posted on any questions.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini
